xml:
GLUCOSE WITH POTASSIUM CHLORIDE, SODIUM BICARBONATE AND SODIUM CHLORIDE Potassium

Formulated as oral rehydration salts

Indications and dose

Fluid and electrolyte loss in diarrhoea

By mouth

  • Adult

    200–400 mL, to be given after every loose motion, dose according to fluid loss.

 Directions for administration

Reconstitute 1 sachet with 200 mL of water (freshly boiled and cooled for infants); 5 sachets when reconstituted with 1 litre of water provide Na+ 50 mmol, K+ 20 mmol, Cl– 40 mmol, HCO3 – 30 mmol, and glucose 111 mmol.
Prescribing and dispensing information

Flavours of oral powder formulations may include banana, orange, black current, lemon and lime, plain, or multiflavoured.
Patient and carer advice

Patients and carers should be advised how to reconstitute Electrolade oral powder.

After reconstitution any unused solution should be discarded no later than 1 hour after preparation unless stored in a refrigerator when it may be kept for up to 24 hours.
Drugs Drug classifications Drugs
